alert.note: Alert for Inland Cameron (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 5:12PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Cameron County through 545 PM CDT... At 509 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking developing strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Valley International Airport to near Progreso City along the Cameron and Hidalgo County line. Storms were developing in place but tending to drift north. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail along with torrential rain reducing visibility below 1 mile. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Torrential rains will briefly reduce visibility below 1 mile and make driving difficult especially on and near IH2 and surrounding highways. Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Harlingen, San Benito, La Feria, Palm Valley, Santa Maria, Rangerville, Doctor Hesiquio Rodriguez Elementary School, Harlingen Arts And Heritage Museum, Harlingen High School and Harlingen Public Library. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
